diagnosisSummary: Mixed metastatic invasive lobular and ductal carcinoma

tumors.name: Lobular Carcinoma In Situ (LCIS)
tumors.location:
Right breast: 2 small tumors (0.4cm and 0.6cm)
Axillary lymph node (0.5cm)

whatThisMeans.goodNews: Because your cancer is hormone receptor positive, endocrine therapy can be very effective at slowing or stopping cancer growth.
whatThisMeans.newOptions: Newer targeted treatments for HER2-low breast cancer may become part of your plan.
whatThisMeans.treatmentFocus: Since the cancer is metastatic, treatment focuses on controlling the disease and helping you feel as well as possible.

testsCompleted.name: MRI-Guided Biopsy
testsCompleted.explanation: Tissue sample taken using magnetic resonance imaging to locate and target suspicious breast area.

testsCompleted.name: Tumor Markers (CA 15-3, CA 27.29, CEA)
testsCompleted.explanation: Measures proteins that cancer cells may release into blood, used to monitor disease progression or recurrence.

testsCompleted.name: Complete Blood Count (CBC)
testsCompleted.explanation: Checks red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets to ensure body is healthy enough for treatment

testsNeeded.name: PET/CT scan (full body scan)
testsNeeded.explanation: To see the complete picture of where cancer has spread

testsNeeded.name: Echocardiogram (heart ultrasound)
testsNeeded.explanation: To make sure your heart is healthy before starting certain treatments

testsNeeded.name: Germline genetic testing
testsNeeded.explanation: Blood test to check for inherited cancer gene changes (like BRCA1/BRCA2)
